doc.title: Sanrio (8136)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Raise PO Reflect growth driven by solid China earnings and video contentRaise PO Reflect growth driven by solid China ea_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 9,100 JPY | Price: 7,711 JPY

We raise our earnings estimates for Sanio and increase our price objective (PO) from ¥8,000 to ¥9,100 (upside potential \(18\%\) ). Our PO is based on a 10- year DCF model (WACC \(4.6\%\) , terminal growth rate \(0\%\) ). We think expectations for China business growth have increased further after 1Q results, and we reiterate our Buy rating.

In the North America business, we lower our FY3/26 sales estimate from ¥32.9bn to ¥31bn (+13% YoY) and operating profit (OP) estimate from ¥13.9bn to ¥10.7bn. However, we still expect sales and profit to increase YoY. In the China business, we substantially raise our FY3/26 sales estimate from ¥23.7bn to ¥28.5bn (+66% YoY) and OP estimate from ¥9.5bn to ¥13.7bn. We raise our consolidated OP estimate from ¥67bn to ¥71.3bn (+38% YoY; guidance ¥67.3bn, Bloomberg consensus ¥68.9bn).

We expect Sanrio to continue benefiting from character anniversaries the next few years, with the 50th anniversary for My Melody and the 20th anniversary for Kuromi coming in FY3/26, and the 30th anniversary for Pompomurin in FY3/27. Thereafter, we expect the release of a Sanrio- financed movie for the domestic market in FY3/27- 28, followed within 1- 2 years by the release of a Hello Kitty movie produced by Warner Bros. We raise our medium- term earnings estimates, as we think Sanrio will enter a period from FY3/27 where it can build on the current level of character recognition by leveraging an increase in character popularity driven by video content.

Sanrio is involved in the production and sale of character goods, including Hello Kitty and My Melody. It continuously develops new characters and has created more than 450 characters to date. It also licenses products in overseas markets and operates theme parks, including Sanrio Puroland. Tomokuni Tsuji, grandson of founder Shintaro Tsuji, took over as president in 2020.

Our Buy thesis is based on three points: (1) we expect OP to grow at a CAGR of \(+35\%\) in FY3/24- FY3/27, and then grow by two digit percentage in each of the next four years, (2) we think Sanrio's current portfolio of 450 characters, led by Hello Kitty, is very competitive for multiple generations of consumers, and (3) we expect overseas contributions to earnings from characters beyond Hello Kitty.

Our price objective of \(9,100 is based on a DCF model for the 10 years of FY3/26- FY3/35. We assume a risk free rate of \(1.0\%\) , risk premium of \(5.5\%\) , and terminal growth rate of \(0\%\) , and apply a WACC of \(4.6\%\) .

Downside risks for our PO are (1) a decline in consumer trends owing to a global economic downturn, (2) failure to cultivate new licensees, and (3) damage to the Sanrio brand image from impropriety involving its products and licensed products.
